The scientific evidence against Genesis as a Literal work is really substantial. However, that doesn't mean it is not truthful and inspired! 
 see: www.songofgenesis.org
 When viewed poetically as it was meant to be read, Genesis and science actually work together!
 If you want to argue Geology, fine. I don't think you have your analysis correct though. For instance, see 
 "Polonium Haloes" Refuted
 
 but I don't think that's the only scientific area in support of an "old" earth.The speed of light and measuring the distance of stars, etc. also points to an older universe.
 However, there is other proof as well in genetics and embryology. For instance, Human beings retain the genetic code for vestigial tails. We have additional genes that "turn off" the coding so that most people do not actually have tails. However, the coccyx, or tailbone, is the remnant of a lost tail. All mammals have a tail at one point in their development. In humans, it is present for a period of 4 weeks, during stages 14 to 22 of human embryonic development. This tail is most visible in human embryos 31-35 days old. The tailbone, (at the end of the spine), has lost its original function in assisting balance and mobility, though it still serves some secondary functions, such as being an attachment point for muscles, which explains why it has not degraded further. (Natural selection - evolution)
 Since tails are part of our genetic code, and part of our embryonic development, why would God have made that little detail if He actually fashioned us out of "dirt". 
 Naturally, this process would have taken a very long time! But God is patient and eternal! 
 Doesn't it make more sense that He guided the process of evolution, and when we were "ready" gave us our immortal souls "in His image?"
 
 There really doesn't have to be a debate on this issue, just a slight change in perspective. God's message is still clear,no?
